newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber ends lower but above lows on covering.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber ends lower but above lows on covering.

text.p: CME lumber futures closed modestly lower in most months on continued weakness in cash lumber prices, but prices ended off the lows on late commission house short covering, traders said.
Lumber closed unchanged to $4.00 per thousand board feet lower with July off $1.30 at $392.60 and September off $0.20 at $381.80.

Declining cash prices weighed on the market early but prices recovered somewhat on commission house short covering ahead of the long holiday weekend. Local long liquidation weighed on the market early, market sources said.
Lumber production appears too large for current demand and is prompting bear spreading, they added.

Random Lengths quoted cash spruce at $377 per tbf, off $4 from midweek and $5 below last Friday. The combination of soft prices and healthy sales seemed to point to strong production as the key to the market's downward drift, they said.
